lines.text: Oh, for ten toes!
And this'll be young Master Hawkins, I'll be bound. Hawkins - 'tis a proper seafaring name, too.
When do we sail?
Better ask Captain Smollett. Five days, he's been selecting a crew. Six men, all he's got to show for it.
Cautious, eh?

Cautious? He pries into every seaman's past like a judge at a quarter session. When I threatened to step in, he told me to hire a sea cook, so, by Jove, I did hire a sea cook, right out of his own tavern! Ha ha! Fellow by the name of Long John Silver. I didn't waste my time poring over his credentials. All the credentials I needed was a taste of his ham and his buttered eggs!
Pirates, Captain Flint! Pirates!
Everything he told us was a lie. I've been a fool, sir.
Now, then, matey, don't ye take it so hard? Why, 'tis lucky you came along, or Ol' John here, he'd have nothing to bargain with. But that don't mean I'd harm a hair o' your little head.
Liar! You let go of me!
Them that die will be the lucky ones!
Fire that musket and I cuts his throat

If sailor tales and sailor tunes, storm and adventure, heat and cold. If schooners, islands and maroons and buccaneers and buried gold, and all the old romance retold exactly in the ancient way can please as me they pleased of old the wiser youngsters of today... So be it!
[Mr. Hands chases Jim Hawkins up the ship's rigging into the crow's nest, but Jim threatens him with a pistol]
Not another step!
smart as paint.
One more step, Mr. Hands, and I'll blow your brains out!
Now, now, matey.
[pulls a knife from his boot]
Matey...
[throws the knife into Jim's shoulder, who promptly blasts Mr. Hands in the face with the pistol, sending him falling into the water]
Arrrh!
[Last lines. As Long John Silver sails away in a small boat]
Goodbye, matey! Good luck to ye! Ha ha!
Blast him! I could almost find it in my heart to hope he makes it.
